Package com.vuzix.hud.resources

Class DynamicThemeApplication

java.lang.Object
android.content.Context
android.content.ContextWrapper
android.app.Application
com.vuzix.hud.resources.DynamicThemeApplication
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2
public abstract class DynamicThemeApplication extends android.app.Application

DynamicThemeApplication is a base class for any app that needs to change themes dynamically as the UI display mode changes. By default, HudTheme and HudTheme.Light will be used as the app's themes. But this can be changed by overriding getNormalThemeResId() and getLightThemeResId().

When the theme needs to change, any subclasses of DynamicThemeActivity in the app will be recreated to allow for the new theme to take effect. Non-activity components who need to know the current UI display mode can call isLightMode() to determine if a lighter theme should be used.

    • isLightMode

      public static boolean isLightMode(android.content.Intent displayModeIntent)
      Determines if the display mode is changing to light mode by examining the provided intent.
      Parameters:
      displayModeIntent - a UI_DISPLAY_MODE intent
      Returns:
      true if the intent is for light mode, false otherwise

    • getNormalThemeResId

      protected int getNormalThemeResId()
      Returns the style resource representing the normal theme for this application. By default HudTheme is used. Subclasses may override.
      Returns:
      a style resource id

    • getLightThemeResId

      protected int getLightThemeResId()
      Returns the style resource representing the light theme for this application. By default HudTheme.Light is used. Subclasses may override.
      Returns:
      a style resource id

    • isLightMode

      public boolean isLightMode()
      Provides a hint about the type of theme that should be used.
      Returns:
      true if this application is running in light mode, false otherwise
